intro: Cirsium neomexicanum, commonly known as the New Mexico thistle, is a perennial plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. It has a robust root system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Cirsium neomexicanum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is considered a native species in its range.
